gobblin.util.io

Class StreamUtils

  • java.lang.Object

extends Object
    Utility class of input/output stream helpers.

      • convertStream

        public static FSDataInputStream convertStream(InputStream in)
                                       throws IOException
        Convert an instance of InputStream to a FSDataInputStream that is Seekable and PositionedReadable.
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:

      • copy

        public static long copy(InputStream is,
                        OutputStream os)
                 throws IOException
        Copies an InputStream to and OutputStream using Channels.

        Note: The method does not close the InputStream and OutputStream. However, the ReadableByteChannel and WritableByteChannels are closed

        Returns:
        Total bytes copied
        Throws:
        IOException

      • copy

        public static long copy(ReadableByteChannel inputChannel,
                        WritableByteChannel outputChannel)
                 throws IOException
        Copies a ReadableByteChannel to a WritableByteChannel.

        Note: The ReadableByteChannel and WritableByteChannels are NOT closed by the method

        Returns:
        Total bytes copied
        Throws:
        IOException

      • tar

        public static void tar(FileSystem fs,
                       Path sourcePath,
                       Path destPath)
                throws IOException
        Creates a tar gzip file using a given Path as input and a given Path as a destination. If the given input is a file then only that file will be added to tarball. If it is a directory then the entire directory will be recursively put into the tarball.
        Parameters:
        fs - the FileSystem the input exists, and the the output should be written to.
        sourcePath - the Path of the input files, this can either be a file or a directory.
        destPath - the Path that tarball should be written to.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • tar

        public static void tar(FileSystem sourceFs,
                       FileSystem destFs,
                       Path sourcePath,
                       Path destPath)
                throws IOException
        Similiar to tar(FileSystem, Path, Path) except the source and destination FileSystem can be different.
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        tar(FileSystem, Path, Path)

      • isCompressed

        public static boolean isCompressed(byte[] bytes)

      • byteBufferToOutputStream

        public static void byteBufferToOutputStream(ByteBuffer in,
                                            OutputStream out)
                                     throws IOException
        Reads the full contents of a ByteBuffer and writes them to an OutputStream. The ByteBuffer is consumed by this operation; eg in.remaining() will be 0 after it completes successfully.
        Parameters:
        in - ByteBuffer to write into the OutputStream
        out - Destination stream
        Throws:
        IOException - If there is an error writing into the OutputStream
